meanings.definition: A beta-blocker medication used to treat high blood pressure and glaucoma.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed timolol to help lower my blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: She takes timolol every day to manage her glaucoma.
meanings.sent3: Timolol is like a superhero for my high blood pressure, fighting it off every day.
meanings.sent4: The timolol works like a shield, protecting my heart from the high blood pressure attacks.
meanings.sent5: I can picture timolol as a brave knight, battling the evil high blood pressure dragon in my body.

meanings.definition: The generic name for a type of medication used to reduce intraocular pressure in the eye.
meanings.sent1: My eye doctor recommended timolol to help lower the pressure in my eye.
meanings.sent2: Using timolol regularly can help manage the intraocular pressure effectively.
meanings.sent3: I joked that timolol is like a tiny umbrella, keeping the eye pressure from raining down on me.
meanings.sent4: The effect of timolol on eye pressure is like a gentle breeze, calming the storm inside my eye.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing timolol as a diligent janitor, sweeping away the excess pressure in my eye, helps me understand its role better.
